verbs.description: < p > [ARG0: The U.S. Supreme Court] [V: sided] [ARG1: with the Trump administration and against China] [ARGM-TMP: on Thursday] [ARG2: on a disputed aspect of their fraught trade relationship] , [ARGM-ADV: throwing out a lower court ruling that had allowed two Chinese vitamin C makers to escape $ 148 million in damages for violating American antitrust] law.</p >

< p > The U.S. Supreme Court sided with the Trump administration and against China on Thursday on a [V: disputed] [ARG2: aspect] of their fraught trade relationship , throwing out a lower court ruling that had allowed two Chinese vitamin C makers to escape $ 148 million in damages for violating American antitrust law.</p >

< p > [ARG0: The U.S. Supreme Court] sided with the Trump administration and against China on Thursday on a disputed aspect of their fraught trade relationship , [V: throwing] [ARG2: out] [ARG1: a lower court ruling that had allowed two Chinese vitamin C makers to escape $ 148 million in damages for violating American antitrust] law.</p >

< p > The U.S. Supreme Court sided with the Trump administration and against China on Thursday on a disputed aspect of their fraught trade relationship , throwing out a lower court ruling that [V: had] allowed two Chinese vitamin C makers to escape $ 148 million in damages for violating American antitrust law.</p >
